title: Diffusion Barrier Layers and Anticorrosive Coatings from Functional Carbon Nanosheets
descriptions:
Abstract:

The proposed project, "Diffusion Barrier Layers and Anticorrosive Coatings from Functional Carbon Nanosheets," seeks to innovate in the field of material science by developing advanced coatings for a range of applications including packaging, sealing, protective encapsulation, and anticorrosive treatments. These applications span critical industries such as food, pharmaceutics, car tires, microelectronics, photovoltaics, displays, and automotive. 

At the core of this project is the utilization of functionalized carbon nanosheets, designed to create atomically dense layers with tailored surface characteristics, resulting in diffusion barriers and anticorrosive properties. The project is driven by technological demands for effectiveness, cost reduction, and environmental friendliness, and presents a substantial business opportunity.

The methods for material preparation include painting, spraying, printing, followed by UV curing, enabling the creation of technology demonstrators: a diffusion barrier layer for packaging applications and a wear-resistant, anti-corrosive coating for metal surfaces. The outcome will offer significant benefits such as excellent barrier properties, tailored surface functionalities, and enhanced wear resistance. This project promises to push the boundaries in coating technologies, contributing to the protection and longevity of materials across various sectors.
